IPL98 Abstract types (global)
[IPL98 Type enumerations and definitions (global)]


Enumerations

enum  IMAGETYPE { BMP, PGM }
 Image types that the library can load: "BMP" and "PGM".

enum  ORIGIN { CAMERA, DISC, RAM, EMPTY }
 Originating points for image: "CAMERA", "DISC", "RAM" and "EMPTY".

enum  COLORTYPE { LOWCOLOR = 0, HIGHCOLOR = 1, UNDEFINED = 2 }
 Three values are avaiable: LOWCOLOR, HIGHCOLOR and UNDEFINED. More...

enum  CONNECTIVITY { FOURCONNECTED = 4, EIGHTCONNECTED = 8 }
 The two values FOURCONNECTED and EIGHTCONNECTED denotes the type of connectivity to be used as described in Gonzalez and Woods page 41.

enum  DIRECTION {
  NORTH, EAST, SOUTH, WEST,
  NORTHEAST, NORTHWEST, SOUTHEAST, SOUTHWEST
}
 The eight values NORTH, EAST, SOUTH, WEST, NORTHEAST, NORTHWEST, SOUTHEAST and SOUTHWEST denotes directions in the image, east is to the right in an image (increasing x-values).

enum  ROTATION { CLOCKWISE, ANTICLOCKWISE }
 The two values CLOCKWISE and ANTICLOCKWISE denotes a rotation direction.

enum  COMPLEXCHOISE { COMPLEX_REAL, COMPLEX_IMAGINARY, COMPLEX_MODULUS }
 The three values COMPLEX_REAL means the real part of a complex value, COMPLEX_IMAGINARY mean the imaginary part of a complex value, and COMPLEX_MODULUS means the modulus of the real an imaginary part.

 Returns a string containing the name of origin.

Detailed Description

Version:
0.90, last updated 12/7/1999
Author:
René Dencker Eriksen edr@mip.sdu.dk

Enumeration Type Documentation

enum COLORTYPE
 

Three values are avaiable: LOWCOLOR, HIGHCOLOR and UNDEFINED.

The two values HIGHCOLOR and LOWCOLOR denotes, if a pixel group was derived from high color or low color pixel values. If not used the value UNDEFINED should be used.

Function Documentation

void k_GetOriginString (  ORIGIN    Origin,
char **    Name
) 
 

Returns a string containing the name of origin.

Allocates memory for the string, so remember to delete this memory!
